section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the local board shall mail by nonforwardable mail a vote-by-mail ballot to each registered voter who is eligible to vote in a special election for the Montgomery County Council.
The local board is not required to mail a vote-by-mail ballot to a voter if the voter has requested that the ballot be sent by other means.

text.section: A voter is not required to submit an application to receive a vote-by-mail ballot.

section.section: Each vote-by-mail ballot shall be accompanied by a postage-paid envelope in which a voter may return the voted ballot to the local board.
The local board shall pay the cost of postage-paid envelopes provided under this subsection.

text.section: The local board shall send a vote-by-mail ballot to each eligible voter at least 14 days before the day of a special election.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, a vote-by-mail ballot shall be mailed to the address that is on file in the statewide voter registration list for each eligible voter.

A registered voter may request to receive a vote-by-mail ballot at an address other than the address that is on file in the statewide voter registration list by:
submitting an absentee ballot application in accordance with § 9-305(a) of this title not later than the Tuesday preceding the day of a special election, if the voter is temporarily absent from the address that is on file in the statewide voter registration list; or
notifying a local board of a change of address not later than the Tuesday preceding the day of a special election, if the voter's residence has changed from the address that is on file in the statewide voter registration list to another location within the State.

text.section: The local board shall issue a replacement vote-by-mail ballot to a voter if the election director of the local board has reasonable grounds to believe that the vote-by-mail ballot previously issued to the voter has been lost, destroyed, or spoiled.
